intro: Hoya lucyae, commonly known as the Lucy's Waxplant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant blooms in shades of white and pink, often appearing during the summer months. Hoya lucyae is a popular houseplant due to its low maintenance and ability to thrive in indirect light. Its unique appearance and ease of care make it a favored choice among indoor gardeners.
